cards.name: Lord of the Pit
cards.text:
Flying, trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature other than Lord of the Pit. If you can't, Lord of the Pit deals 7 damage to you.

rulings.text: If you control any other creatures as Lord of the Pit’s triggered ability resolves, you must sacrifice one. You can’t choose to be dealt 7 damage instead.

If Lord of the Pit has gained lifelink, being dealt 7 damage by it doesn’t cause your life total to change, even though you gain and lose life. If your life total is less than 7, you won’t lose the game.
If you have two Lords of the Pit, you can sacrifice them to each other.

cards.originalText:
Flying, trample
You must sacrifice one of your own creatures during upkeep or Lord of the Pit does 7 damage to you. You may still attack with Lord of the Pit even if you failed to sacrifice a creature.

cards.name: Mind Twist
cards.text: Target player discards X cards at random.
cards.originalText: Opponent must discard X cards at random from hand. If opponent doesn't have enough cards in hand, entire hand is discarded.

cards.name: Nether Shadow
cards.text:
Haste
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Nether Shadow is in your graveyard with three or more creature cards above it, you may put Nether Shadow onto the battlefield.

rulings.text: Since it enters the battlefield due to triggering at the beginning of upkeep, it is not possible to get an infinite loop with four Nether Shadows.
Note that bringing the Shadow back onto the battlefield from the graveyard is not a spell, it is an ability. It can’t be countered with something that counters spells.
Players may not rearrange the cards in their graveyards.

The last thing that happens to a resolving instant or sorcery spell is that it’s put into its owner’s graveyard. Example: You cast Wrath of God. All creatures on the battlefield are destroyed. You arrange all the cards put into your graveyard this way in any order you want. The other players in the game do the same to the cards that are put into their graveyards. Then you put Wrath of God into your graveyard, on top of the other cards.

Say you’re the owner of both a permanent and an Aura that’s attached to it. If both the permanent and the Aura are destroyed at the same time (by Akroma’s Vengeance, for example), you decide the order they’re put into your graveyard. If just the enchanted permanent is destroyed, it’s put into your graveyard first. Then, after state-based actions are checked, the Aura (which is no longer attached to anything) is put into your graveyard on top of it.
A card is “above” another card in your graveyard if it was put into that graveyard later.
If an effect or rule puts two or more cards into the same graveyard at the same time, the owner of those cards may arrange them in any order.

cards.originalText: If Shadow is in graveyard with any combination of cards above it that includes at least three creatures, it can be returned to play during upkeep for its normal casting cost. Shadow can attack on same turn summoned or returned to play.

cards.name: Nettling Imp
cards.text: {T}: Choose target non-Wall creature the active player has controlled continuously since the beginning of the turn. That creature attacks this turn if able. Destroy it at the beginning of the next end step if it didn't attack this turn. Activate this ability only during an opponent's turn, before attackers are declared.

rulings.text: If the Imp leaves the battlefield before the end of the turn, the creature still is destroyed.
You can use this effect on a creature you know won’t be able to attack. For example, you can use it on a tapped creature.
The creature is destroyed if it does not attack because it simply can’t do so legally.
If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

cards.originalText: Tap to force a particular one of opponent's non-wall creatures to attack. If target creature cannot attack, it is destroyed at end of turn. This tap should be played during opponent's turn, before the attack. May not be used on creatures summoned this turn.

cards.name: Nightmare
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Nightmare's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Swamps you control.
cards.flavor: The Nightmare arises from its lair in the swamps. As the poisoned land spreads, so does the Nightmare's rage and terrifying strength.

rulings.text: If you control 0 swamps, then the Nightmare has 0 toughness and will be put into its owner’s graveyard as a state-based action right before the next player gains priority.
Nightmare’s power and toughness changes as the number of Swamps you control changes.
The ability that defines Nightmare’s power and toughness works everywhere, not just on the battlefield.
Nightmare’s ability counts all lands you control with the subtype Swamp, not just ones named Swamp.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Nightmare's power and toughness both equal the number of swamps its controller has in play.

cards.name: Paralyze
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Paralyze enters the battlefield, tap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, that player may pay {4}. If the player does, untap the creature.

rulings.text: Paying the cost is optional.
Paralyze can be cast targeting a creature which is already tapped.
The creature can only be untapped using Paralyze once per turn.
Two Paralyzes are not cumulative. Paying either one will untap the creature.
This is a change from the most recent wording. As was the case in the past, Paralyze itself has the last triggered ability, rather than granting that ability to the enchanted creature.

cards.originalText: Target creature is not untapped as normal during untap phase unless 4 mana are spent. Tap target creature when Paralyze is cast.

cards.name: Pestilence
cards.text:
At the beginning of the end step, if no creatures are on the battlefield, sacrifice Pestilence.
{B}: Pestilence deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.

rulings.text: Each activation is considered a new damage effect. An activation can only be 1 point of damage.
Note that “until end of turn” effects wear off after “at the beginning of the end step” triggered abilities, so an artifact that animates until end of turn can keep this on the battlefield.

It will stay on the battlefield if there is a creature that is put into the graveyard during the end step. This is because this ability will not trigger at all if there is at least one creature on the battlefield as the end step begins.

cards.originalText: oB: Do 1 damage to each creature and to both players. Pestilence must be discarded at end of any turn in which there are no creatures in play at end of turn.

cards.name: Plague Rats
cards.text: Plague Rats's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures named Plague Rats on the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
"Should you a Rat to madness tease Why ev'n a Rat may plague you..."
—Samuel Coleridge, *"Recantation"*
cards.originalText: The Xs below are the number of Plague Rats in play, counting both sides. Thus if there are 2 Plague Rats in play, each has power and toughness 2/2.

cards.name: Raise Dead
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

rulings.text: You must show the card you bring out of the graveyard to your opponent.
The creature being brought back is chosen on announcement and not on resolution of the spell because it is targeted.

cards.originalText: Return creature from  your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Royal Assassin
cards.text: {T}: Destroy target tapped creature.
cards.flavor: Trained in the arts of stealth, the royal assassins choose their victims carefully, relying on timing and precision rather than brute force.

rulings.text: Can’t target itself because you choose the target before you tap him. At that time he is not yet a legal target.
If the creature is no longer tapped when the Assassin’s ability resolves, then the ability doesn’t resolve.

cards.originalText: Tap to destroy any tapped creature.

cards.name: Sacrifice
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Add an amount of {B} equal to the sacrificed creature's converted mana cost.

rulings.text: Sacrificing an animated land gives no mana since the converted mana cost was zero.
You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

cards.originalText: Destroy one of your creatures without regenerating it, and add to your mana pool a number of black mana equal to creature's casting cost.

cards.name: Scathe Zombies
cards.flavor:
"They groaned, they stirred, they all uprose,/ Nor spake, nor moved their eyes;/ It had been strange, even in a dream,/ To have seen those dead men rise."/
—Samuel Coleridge, *"The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"*

cards.name: Scavenging Ghoul
cards.text:
At the beginning of each end step, put a corpse counter on Scavenging Ghoul for each creature that died this turn.
Remove a corpse counter from Scavenging Ghoul: Regenerate Scavenging Ghoul.

rulings.text: The Ghoul still gets to claim counters even if it enters the battlefield after the creatures died.

cards.originalText: At the end of each turn, put one counter on the Ghoul for each other creature that was destroyed without regenerating during the turn. If Ghoul dies, you may use a counter to regenerate it; counters remain until used.

cards.name: Sengir Vampire
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Sengir Vampire this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Vampire.

rulings.text: If Sengir Vampire deals nonlethal damage to a creature and then a different effect or damage source causes that creature to be put into a graveyard later in the turn, Sengir Vampire’s ability will trigger and it will get a +1/+1 counter.

Each time a creature is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, check whether Sengir Vampire had dealt any damage to it at any time during that turn. If so, Sengir Vampire’s ability will trigger. It doesn’t matter who controlled the creature or whose graveyard it was put into.
If Sengir Vampire and a creature it dealt damage to are both put into a graveyard at the same time, Sengir Vampire’s ability will trigger, but it will do nothing when it resolves.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Vampire gets a +1/+1 counter each time a creature dies during a turn in which Vampire damaged it, unless the dead creature is regenerated.

cards.name: Simulacrum
cards.text: You gain life equal to the damage dealt to you this turn. Simulacrum deals damage to target creature you control equal to the damage dealt to you this turn.

rulings.text: You can’t use Simulacrum on Loss of Life, just damage.
This is not damage prevention or redirection. It actually is life gain and newly dealt damage.
Simulacrum is the source of the damage. If an effect needs to know a characteristic of the damage’s source (Protection from Black, for instance), it will see the damage coming from Simulacrum.

cards.originalText: All damage done to you so far this turn is instead retroactively applied to one of your creatures in play. If this damage kills the creature it can be regenerated; even if there's more than enough damage to kill the creature, you don't suffer any of it. Further damage this turn is treated normally.

cards.name: Sinkhole
cards.text: Destroy target land.
cards.originalText: Destroys any one land.

cards.name: Terror
cards.text: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.originalText: Destroys target creature without possibility of regeneration. Does not affect black creatures and artifact creatures.

cards.name: Unholy Strength
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1.
cards.originalText: Target creature gains +2/+1.

cards.name: Wall of Bone
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{B}: Regenerate Wall of Bone. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
cards.flavor: The Wall of Bone is said to be an aspect of the Great Wall in Hel, where the bones of all sinners wait for Ragnarok, when Hela will call them forth for the final battle.
cards.originalText: ooB Regenerates

cards.name: Warp Artifact
cards.text:
Enchant artifact
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted artifact's controller, Warp Artifact deals 1 damage to that player.
cards.originalText: Warp Artifact does 1 damage to target artifact's controller at start of each turn.

cards.name: Weakness
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -2/-1.
cards.originalText: Target creature loses -2/-1; if this drops the creature's toughness below 1, it is dead.

cards.name: Will-o'-the-Wisp
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{B}: Regenerate Will-o'-the-Wisp. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
cards.flavor:
"About, about in reel and rout The death-fires danced at night; The water, like a witch's oils, Burnt green, and blue and white."
—Samuel Coleridge, *"The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"*
cards.originalText: Flying; ooB Regenerates

cards.name: Word of Command
cards.text: Look at target opponent's hand and choose a card from it. You control that player until Word of Command finishes resolving. The player plays that card if able. While doing so, the player can activate mana abilities only if they're from lands that player controls and only if mana they produce is spent to activate other mana abilities of lands the player controls and/or to play that card. If the chosen card is cast as a spell, you control the player while that spell is resolving.

rulings.text: To “play a card” is to either cast a spell or to put a land onto the battlefield using the main phase special action.

You do get to choose which lands get tapped. You can make them choose an optional mana generating ability of the land that they tap, such as making them tap and sacrifice the land instead of just tap it.

You control the player while this spell is resolving, which means you get to see anything they can see. If that player is required to search their library as part of playing the card or as part of its resolution if it’s cast as a spell, then you can see the cards in that player’s library as well.
Your opponent can’t counter the Word of Command after letting you look at their hand, but they can attempt to counter the spell you force them to cast.
You may Command your opponent to play a land (if they have not already done so this turn).
If there is a non-mana way to cast a spell, as with Pitch Spells, you may require that way to be used if it is possible to do so.

Since this spell is an instant, your opponent gets a chance to respond to it as normal. Once this spell resolves, you look at your opponent’s hand and choose a card. Note that it is common practice to respond to Word of Command by using up any spells or mana you have prior to letting it resolve.
During the resolution of this spell, that player plays the chosen card.
You must order your opponent to play the chosen card if it is possible to do so.
Word of Command can’t be used to force a player to play a card that isn’t in their hand.

While controlling another player, you can see all cards in the game that player can see. This includes cards in that player’s hand, face-down cards that player controls, and any cards in that player’s library the player may look at.
Controlling a player doesn’t allow you to look at that player’s sideboard. If an effect instructs that player to choose a card from outside the game, you can’t have that player choose any card.

cards.originalText: You may look at opponent's hand and choose any card opponent can legally play using mana from his or her mana pool or lands. Opponent must play this card immediately; you make all the decisions it calls for. This spell may not be countered after you have looked at opponent's hand.

cards.name: Zombie Master
cards.text:
Other Zombie creatures have swampwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
Other Zombies have "{B}: Regenerate this permanent."
cards.flavor: They say the Zombie Master controlled these foul creatures even before his own death, but now that he is one of them, nothing can make them betray him.
cards.originalText: All zombies in play gain swampwalk and "ooB Regenerates" for as long as this card remains in play.

cards.name: Atraxa, Praetors' Voice
cards.text:
Flying, vigilance, deathtouch, lifelink
At the beginning of your end step, proliferate. (Choose any number of permanents and/or players, then give each another counter of each kind already there.)

rulings.text: As you proliferate, you can choose any players that have counters, including yourself.

You can choose any permanent that has a counter, including ones controlled by opponents. You can’t choose cards in any zone other than the battlefield, even if they have counters on them, such as suspended cards or a Lightning Storm on the stack.

You don’t have to choose every permanent or player that has a counter; you choose only the ones you want to add another counter to. Since “any number” includes zero, you don’t have to choose any permanents at all, and you don’t have to choose any players at all.
If a player or permanent chosen this way has multiple kinds of counters, only a single new counter is given. You choose which kind of counter to give that permanent or player as you proliferate.

Players can respond to the spell or ability whose effect includes proliferating. Once that spell or ability starts to resolve, however, and its controller chooses which permanents and players will get new counters, it’s too late for anyone to respond.

If a creature has +1/+1 counters and -1/-1 counters on it, state-based actions remove the same number of each so that it has only one of those kinds of counters on it. There won’t be any counters of the other kind to put onto it as you proliferate.

cards.name: Atraxa, Praetors' Voice
cards.text:
Flying, vigilance, deathtouch, lifelink
At the beginning of your end step, proliferate. (Choose any number of permanents and/or players, then give each another counter of each kind already there.)

rulings.text: As you proliferate, you can choose any players that have counters, including yourself.

You can choose any permanent that has a counter, including ones controlled by opponents. You can’t choose cards in any zone other than the battlefield, even if they have counters on them, such as suspended cards or a Lightning Storm on the stack.

You don’t have to choose every permanent or player that has a counter; you choose only the ones you want to add another counter to. Since “any number” includes zero, you don’t have to choose any permanents at all, and you don’t have to choose any players at all.
If a player or permanent chosen this way has multiple kinds of counters, only a single new counter is given. You choose which kind of counter to give that permanent or player as you proliferate.

Players can respond to the spell or ability whose effect includes proliferating. Once that spell or ability starts to resolve, however, and its controller chooses which permanents and players will get new counters, it’s too late for anyone to respond.

If a creature has +1/+1 counters and -1/-1 counters on it, state-based actions remove the same number of each so that it has only one of those kinds of counters on it. There won’t be any counters of the other kind to put onto it as you proliferate.

cards.name: Baleful Strix
cards.text:
Flying, deathtouch
When Baleful Strix enters the battlefield, draw a card.
cards.flavor: Its beak rends flesh and bone, exposing the tender marrow of dream.

cards.name: Kaalia of the Vast
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Kaalia of the Vast attacks an opponent, you may put an Angel, Demon, or Dragon creature card from your hand onto the battlefield tapped and attacking that opponent.
cards.flavor: "I'll have my revenge if I have to call on every force from above and below."

rulings.text: Kaalia’s ability doesn’t trigger if it attacks a planeswalker.
The creature card is already tapped and attacking as it’s put onto the battlefield. Any abilities that trigger when a creature becomes tapped or when a creature attacks won’t trigger for that card.

If the opponent Kaalia attacked is no longer in the game when its ability resolves, you may put an Angel, Demon, or Dragon creature card onto the battlefield tapped, but it won’t be attacking anyone and it won’t be an attacking creature.

cards.name: Kaalia of the Vast
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Kaalia of the Vast attacks an opponent, you may put an Angel, Demon, or Dragon creature card from your hand onto the battlefield tapped and attacking that opponent.

rulings.text: Kaalia’s ability doesn’t trigger if it attacks a planeswalker.
The creature card is already tapped and attacking as it’s put onto the battlefield. Any abilities that trigger when a creature becomes tapped or when a creature attacks won’t trigger for that card.

If the opponent Kaalia attacked is no longer in the game when its ability resolves, you may put an Angel, Demon, or Dragon creature card onto the battlefield tapped, but it won’t be attacking anyone and it won’t be an attacking creature.

cards.name: Animate Dead
cards.text:
Enchant creature card in a graveyard
When Animate Dead enters the battlefield, if it's on the battlefield, it loses "enchant creature card in a graveyard" and gains "enchant creature put onto the battlefield with Animate Dead." Return enchanted creature card to the battlefield under your control and attach Animate Dead to it. When Animate Dead leaves the battlefield, that creature's controller sacrifices it.
Enchanted creature gets -1/-0.

rulings.text: Animate Dead is an Aura, albeit with an unusual enchant ability. You target a creature card in a graveyard when you cast it. It enters the battlefield attached to that card. Then it returns that card to the battlefield, and attaches itself to the card again (since the card is a new object on the battlefield). Animate Dead itself never moves into a graveyard during this process.
If Animate Dead isn’t on the battlefield as its triggered ability resolves, none of its effects happen. The creature card won’t be returned to the battlefield.

Abilities such as shroud and protection function only on the battlefield unless otherwise specified. A creature card with shroud may be targeted by Animate Dead, and Animate Dead will become attached to the creature that enters the battlefield.

If the creature put onto the battlefield has protection from black—or if the creature can’t legally be enchanted by Animate Dead for another reason—Animate Dead won’t be able to attach to it. It will be put into the graveyard as a state-based action, causing its delayed triggered ability to trigger. When the trigger resolves, if the creature’s still on the battlefield, its controller will sacrifice it.

Once the creature is returned to the battlefield, Animate Dead can’t be attached to anything other than it (unless Animate Dead somehow manages to put a different creature onto the battlefield). Attempting to move Animate Dead to another creature won’t work.

foreignNames.name: Belebung der Toten
foreignNames.text: Nimm eine Kreatur aus einem der Friedhöfe und bringe sie sofort auf Deiner Seite mit -1/-0 ins Spiel. Behandle diese Kreatur, als wäre sie gerade erst beschworen worden. Wenn die Verzauberung entfernt wird, begrabe sie auf dem Friedhof ihres Eigentümers.

cards.originalText: Any creature in any graveyard comes into play on your side with -1 to its original power. At end of game, or if this enchantment is discarded without removing target creature from play, target creature is returned to its owner's graveyard. Target creature may be killed as normal.

cards.name: Bad Moon
cards.text: Black creatures get +1/+1.

foreignNames.name: Mondschatten
foreignNames.text: Alle schwarzen Kreaturen erhalten +1/+1.

cards.originalText: All black creatures in play gain +1/+1.

cards.name: Black Knight
cards.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Protection from white (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything white.)
cards.flavor: Battle doesn't need a purpose; the battle is its own purpose. You don't ask why a plague spreads or a field burns. Don't ask why I fight.

foreignNames.name: Schwarzer Ritter
foreignNames.text: Schutz gegen Weiß, Erstschlag

cards.originalText: Protection from white, first strike

cards.name: Bog Wraith
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
cards.flavor: 'Twas in the bogs of Cannelbrae My mate did meet an early grave 'Twas nothing left for us to save In the peat-filled bogs of Cannelbrae.

foreignNames.name: Todlose Moorleiche
foreignNames.text: Sumpftarnung

cards.originalText: Swampwalk

cards.name: Contract from Below
cards.text:
Remove Contract from Below from your deck before playing if you're not playing for ante.
Discard your hand, ante the top card of your library, then draw seven cards.

foreignNames.name: Vertrag mit der Unterwelt
foreignNames.text: Wirf alle Karten in Deiner Hand ab und ziehe acht neue Karten. Die erste Karte, die Du ziehst, fügst Du Deinem Einsatz hinzu. Nimm diese Karte vor dem Spiel aus Deinem Stapel, wenn ohne Einsatz gespielt wird.

cards.originalText: Discard your current hand and draw eight new cards, adding the first drawn to your ante. Remove this card from your deck before playing if you are not playing for ante.

cards.name: Cursed Land
cards.text:
Enchant land
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted land's controller, Cursed Land deals 1 damage to that player.

foreignNames.name: Verfluchtes Land
foreignNames.text: Während der Versorgungsphase des Beherrschers des verzauberten Landes fügt ihm das Verfluchte Land 1 Schadenspunkt zu.

cards.originalText: Cursed Land does 1 damage to target land's controller during his or her upkeep.

cards.name: Dark Ritual
cards.text: Add {B}{B}{B}.

foreignNames.name: Schwarzer Ritus
foreignNames.text: Erhöhe Deinen Manavorrat um BBB.

cards.originalText: Add oBoBoB to your mana pool.

cards.name: Darkpact
cards.text:
Remove Darkpact from your deck before playing if you're not playing for ante.
You own target card in the ante. Exchange that card with the top card of your library.

foreignNames.name: Vertrag mit der Dunkelheit
foreignNames.text: Wirf alle Karten in Deiner Hand ab und ziehe acht neue Karten. Die erste Karte, die Du ziehst, fügst Du Deinem Einsatz hinzu. Nimm diese Karte vor dem Spiel aus dem Stapel, wenn ohne Einsatz gespielt wird.

cards.originalText: Swap top card of your library with either card of the ante; this swap is permanent. You must have a card in your library to cast this spell. Remove this card from your deck before playing if you are not playing for ante.

cards.name: Deathgrip
cards.text: {B}{B}: Counter target green spell.

foreignNames.name: Todesgriff
foreignNames.text: {B}{B}: Neutralisiere einen grünen Spruch. Spiele diese Eigenschaft wie einen Unterbrechungszauber.

cards.originalText: oBooB Counter a green spell as it is being cast. This ability is played as an interrupt and does not affect green cards already in play.

cards.name: Deathlace
cards.text: Target spell or permanent becomes black. (Mana symbols on that permanent remain unchanged.)

foreignNames.name: Todesgewebe
foreignNames.text: Die Farbe einer entweder im Spiel befindlichen oder gerade gespielten Karte verändert sich in Schwarz. Völlig unberührt davon bleiben der Gebrauch einer bestimmten Fähigkeit und die Kosten der Heraufbeschwörung, des Tappens oder der Versorgung der veränderten Karte.

cards.originalText: Changes the color of one card either being played or already in play to black. Cost to cast, tap, maintain, or use a special ability of target card remains entirely unchanged.

cards.name: Demonic Attorney
cards.text:
Remove Demonic Attorney from your deck before playing if you're not playing for ante.
Each player antes the top card of their library.

foreignNames.name: Advocatus Diaboli
foreignNames.text: Gibt der Gegner das Spiel nicht sofort ab, muß jeder Spieler die oberste Karte aus seiner Bibliothek zusätzlich zum Einsatz legen. Nimm diese Karte vor dem Spiel aus deinem Stapel, wenn ohne Einsatz gespielt wird.

cards.originalText: If opponent doesn't concede the game immediately, each player must ante an additional card from the top of his or her library. Remove this card from your deck before playing if you are not playing for ante.

cards.name: Demonic Hordes
cards.text:
{T}: Destroy target land.
At the beginning of your upkeep, unless you pay {B}{B}{B}, tap Demonic Hordes and sacrifice a land of an opponent's choice.
cards.flavor: Created to destroy Dominia, Demons can sometimes be bent to a more focused purpose.

foreignNames.name: Dämonische Horden
foreignNames.text:
{T}: Zerstöre ein Land.
Zahle BBB während Deiner Versorgungsphase oder die Horden werden getappt und Du verlierst ein Land, das Dein Gegner auswählt.

cards.originalText:
ocT: Destroy 1 land.
Pay oBoBoB during your upkeep or the Hordes become tapped and you lose a land of opponent's choice.

cards.name: Demonic Tutor
cards.text: Search your library for a card, put that card into your hand, then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: You pick a card on resolution.
You don’t reveal the card to your opponent.
This card is put directly into your hand. It is not drawn.

foreignNames.name: Dämonischer Tutor
foreignNames.text: Hole eine Karte Deiner Wahl aus der Bibliothek in Dein Blatt. Vergiß nicht, Deine Bibliothek danach neu zu mischen.

cards.originalText: Search your library for one card and take it into your hand. Reshuffle your library afterwards.

cards.name: Drain Life
cards.text:
Spend only black mana on X.
Drain Life deals X damage to any target. You gain life equal to the damage dealt, but not more life than the player's life total before the damage was dealt, the planeswalker's loyalty before the damage was dealt, or the creature's toughness.

rulings.text: Cost reducers can be used to reduce the X part of the mana cost.
You may gain up to the total toughness of the creature even if it was already damaged.

foreignNames.name: Dunkler Sog
foreignNames.text: Für jedes {B} das Du zusätzlich zu den Beschwörungskosten ausgibst, fügt der Dunkle Sog seinem Ziel -das kann sowohl Spieler als auch Kreatur seineinen Schadenspunkt zu. Sodann bekommst Du für jeden so angerichteten Schadenspunkt 1 Lebenspunkt dazu. Du kannst allerdings nicht mehr Lebenspunkte gewinnen als die Kreatur Widerstandskraft bzw. der Spieler Lebenspunkte besitzt.

cards.originalText: Drain Life does 1 damage to a single target for each oB spent in addition to the casting cost. Caster gains 1 life for each damage inflicted. If you drain life from a creature, you cannot gain more life than the creature's current toughness.

cards.name: Drudge Skeletons
cards.text: {B}: Regenerate Drudge Skeletons. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
cards.flavor: Bones scattered around us joined to form misshapen bodies. We struck at them repeatedly—they fell, but soon formed again, with the same mocking look on their faceless skulls.

foreignNames.name: Heer der geplagten Skelette
foreignNames.text: {B}: Regeneration
foreignNames.flavor: Die Knochen um uns herum fügten sich zu missgestalteten Skeletten zusammen, obwohl wir sie immer wieder zerschlugen.

cards.originalText: ooB Regenerates.

cards.name: El-Hajjâj
cards.text: Whenever El-Hajjâj deals damage, you gain that much life.

foreignNames.name: El-Hajjâj
foreignNames.text: Du gewinnst 1 Lebenspunkt für jeden Schadenspunkt, den El-Hajjâj beliebigen Gegnern zufügt. Du kannst allerdings nicht mehr Lebenspunkte gewinnen, als die angegriffene Kreatur Widerstandskraft bzw. der Spieler Lebenspunkte besitzt.

cards.originalText: You gain 1 life for every point of damage El-Hajjâj inflicts.

cards.name: Erg Raiders
cards.text: At the beginning of your end step, if Erg Raiders didn't attack this turn, Erg Raiders deals 2 damage to you unless it came under your control this turn.

rulings.text: A creature “comes under your control” if it enters the battlefield under your control or if you gain control of it while it’s already on the battlefield.

foreignNames.name: Wüstenräuber
foreignNames.text: Wenn Du mit den Räubern nicht angreifst, fügen sie Dir am Ende der Runde 2 Schadenspunkte zu —allerdings nicht in der Runde, in der Du sie beschworen hast.

cards.originalText: If you do not attack with Raiders, they do 2 damage to you at end of turn. Raiders do no damage to you during the turn in which they are summoned.

cards.name: Evil Presence
cards.text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land is a Swamp.

rulings.text: The enchanted land loses its existing land types and any abilities printed on it. It now has the land type Swamp and has the ability “{T}: Add {B}.” Evil Presence doesn’t change the enchanted land’s name or whether it’s legendary, basic, or snow.

foreignNames.name: Gegenwart des Bösen
foreignNames.text: Das verzauberte Land wird zu einem Standard-Sumpf.

cards.originalText: Target land is now a basic swamp.

cards.name: Fear
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

foreignNames.name: Furcht
foreignNames.text: Die verzauberte Kreatur kann nur durch schwarze Kreaturen und Artefaktkreaturen geblockt werden.

cards.originalText: Target creature cannot be blocked by any creatures except black creatures and artifact creatures.

cards.name: Frozen Shade
cards.text: {B}: Frozen Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "There are some qualities—some incorporate things,/ That have a double life, which thus is made/ A type of twin entity which springs/ From matter and light, evinced in solid and shade." —Edgar Allan Poe, "Silence"

foreignNames.name: Schauriger Schatten
foreignNames.text: {B}: +1/+1 bis zum Ende des Zuges

cards.name: Gloom
cards.text:
White spells cost {3} more to cast.
Activated abilities of white enchantments cost {3} more to activate.

rulings.text: The extra mana is not considered part of the activation cost. It is a separate cost.
The additional mana is paid at the same time the spell/ability is cast/activated.
The extra mana is part of the total cost, so cost reducers can be applied to this cost.
Activated abilities contain a colon. They’re generally written “[Cost]: [Effect].” Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text.

foreignNames.name: Düsternis
foreignNames.text: Das Sprechen weißer Zaubersprüche verteuert sich um 3 Mana. Weiße Verzauberungen mit Aktivierungskosten werden ebenfalls um 3 Mana teurer.

cards.originalText: White spells cost 3 more mana to cast. White enchantments with activation costs require 3 more mana to use.

cards.name: Howl from Beyond
cards.text: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.

foreignNames.name: Heulen aus dem Jenseits
foreignNames.text: Die Zielkreatur erhält +X/+0 bis zum Ende des Zuges.

cards.originalText: Target creature gains +X/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Hypnotic Specter
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Hypnotic Specter deals damage to an opponent, that player discards a card at random.
cards.flavor: "...There was no trace/ Of aught on that illumined face..." —Samuel Coleridge, "Phantom"

rulings.text: The ability triggers even if the Specter’s damage is being redirected to an opponent. It does not trigger if damage that would have been dealt to the opponent is redirected to a nonopponent player or a creature, or if the damage is prevented.

foreignNames.name: Hypnotisierendes Gespenst
foreignNames.text:
Kann fliegen.
Fügt das Gespenst einem Spieler Schaden zu, so muß dieser eine zufällig gewählte Karte aus seiner Hand abwerfen. Hat derjenige Spieler keine Karten auf der Hand, ignoriere diesen Effekt.

cards.originalText:
Flying
An opponent damaged by Specter must discard a card at random from his or her hand. Ignore this effect if opponent has no cards left in hand.

cards.name: Lord of the Pit
cards.text:
Flying, trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature other than Lord of the Pit. If you can't, Lord of the Pit deals 7 damage to you.

rulings.text: If you control any other creatures as Lord of the Pit’s triggered ability resolves, you must sacrifice one. You can’t choose to be dealt 7 damage instead.

If Lord of the Pit has gained lifelink, being dealt 7 damage by it doesn’t cause your life total to change, even though you gain and lose life. If your life total is less than 7, you won’t lose the game.
If you have two Lords of the Pit, you can sacrifice them to each other.

foreignNames.name: Fürst der Unterwelt
foreignNames.text:
Kann fliegen und verursacht Trampelschaden
Opfere während Deiner Versorgungsphase eine Deiner eigenen Kreaturen. Wenn Du keine Kreatur opfern kannst, fügt Dir der Fürst der Unterwelt 7 Schadenspunkte zu. Du kannst den Fürsten der Unterwelt nicht sich selbst opfern.

cards.originalText:
Flying, trample
You must sacrifice one of your own creatures during your upkeep or Lord of the Pit does 7 damage to you. You may still attack with Lord of the Pit even if you failed to sacrifice a creature. Lord of the Pit may not be sacrificed to itself.

cards.name: Mind Twist
cards.text: Target player discards X cards at random.

foreignNames.name: Wahnsinn
foreignNames.text: Ein Spieler Deiner Wahl muß X zufällig ausgesuchte Karten aus seiner Hand abwerfen. Hat er nicht genug Karten, dann muß er alle seine Karten abwerfen.

cards.originalText: Opponent must discard X cards at random from hand. If opponent doesn't have enough cards in hand, entire hand is discarded.

cards.name: Nether Shadow
cards.text:
Haste
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Nether Shadow is in your graveyard with three or more creature cards above it, you may put Nether Shadow onto the battlefield.

rulings.text: Since it enters the battlefield due to triggering at the beginning of upkeep, it is not possible to get an infinite loop with four Nether Shadows.
Note that bringing the Shadow back onto the battlefield from the graveyard is not a spell, it is an ability. It can’t be countered with something that counters spells.
Players may not rearrange the cards in their graveyards.

The last thing that happens to a resolving instant or sorcery spell is that it’s put into its owner’s graveyard. Example: You cast Wrath of God. All creatures on the battlefield are destroyed. You arrange all the cards put into your graveyard this way in any order you want. The other players in the game do the same to the cards that are put into their graveyards. Then you put Wrath of God into your graveyard, on top of the other cards.

Say you’re the owner of both a permanent and an Aura that’s attached to it. If both the permanent and the Aura are destroyed at the same time (by Akroma’s Vengeance, for example), you decide the order they’re put into your graveyard. If just the enchanted permanent is destroyed, it’s put into your graveyard first. Then, after state-based actions are checked, the Aura (which is no longer attached to anything) is put into your graveyard on top of it.
A card is “above” another card in your graveyard if it was put into that graveyard later.
If an effect or rule puts two or more cards into the same graveyard at the same time, the owner of those cards may arrange them in any order.

foreignNames.name: Niederschatten
foreignNames.text: Liegt der Schatten am Ende Deiner Versorgungsphase auf Deinem Friedhof und liegen noch mindestens drei Kreaturen über ihm, kannst Du ihn ins Spiel zurückbringen. Der Schatten kann in derselben Runde angreifen, in der er heraufbeschworen oder ins Spiel zurückgekehrt ist.

cards.originalText: If Shadow is in graveyard with any combination of cards above it that includes at least three creatures, it can be returned to play during your upkeep. Shadow can attack on same turn summoned or returned to play.

cards.name: Nettling Imp
cards.text: {T}: Choose target non-Wall creature the active player has controlled continuously since the beginning of the turn. That creature attacks this turn if able. Destroy it at the beginning of the next end step if it didn't attack this turn. Activate this ability only during an opponent's turn, before attackers are declared.

rulings.text: If the Imp leaves the battlefield before the end of the turn, the creature still is destroyed.
You can use this effect on a creature you know won’t be able to attack. For example, you can use it on a tapped creature.
The creature is destroyed if it does not attack because it simply can’t do so legally.
If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

foreignNames.name: Quälbold
foreignNames.text: Zwinge eine Nicht-Mauer-Kreatur Deines Gegners zum Angriff. Kann diese Kreatur nicht angreifen, stirbt sie am Ende des Zuges. Diese Fähigkeit kannst Du nur während des Zuges Deines Gegners anwenden, und zwar noch vor dessen Angriffsphase. Kreaturen, die erst während dieses Zuges heraufbeschworen wurden und somit unter Einsatzverzögerung leiden, können nicht zum Angriff gezwungen werden.

cards.originalText: ocT: Force a particular one of opponent's non-wall creatures to attack. If target creature cannot attack, it is killed at end of turn. This ability can only be used during opponent's turn, before the attack. May not be used on creatures summoned this turn.

cards.name: Nightmare
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Nightmare's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Swamps you control.
cards.flavor: The Nightmare arises from its lair in the swamps. As the poisoned land spreads, so does the Nightmare's rage and terrifying strength.

rulings.text: If you control 0 swamps, then the Nightmare has 0 toughness and will be put into its owner’s graveyard as a state-based action right before the next player gains priority.
Nightmare’s power and toughness changes as the number of Swamps you control changes.
The ability that defines Nightmare’s power and toughness works everywhere, not just on the battlefield.
Nightmare’s ability counts all lands you control with the subtype Swamp, not just ones named Swamp.

foreignNames.name: Nachtmahr
foreignNames.text:
Kann fliegen.
Stärke und Widerstandskraft des Nachtmahrs entsprechen der Anzahl der Sümpfe, die der Beherrscher im Spiel hat.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Nightmare's power and toughness both equal the number of swamps its controller has in play.

cards.name: Paralyze
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Paralyze enters the battlefield, tap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, that player may pay {4}. If the player does, untap the creature.

rulings.text: Paying the cost is optional.
Paralyze can be cast targeting a creature which is already tapped.
The creature can only be untapped using Paralyze once per turn.
Two Paralyzes are not cumulative. Paying either one will untap the creature.
This is a change from the most recent wording. As was the case in the past, Paralyze itself has the last triggered ability, rather than granting that ability to the enchanted creature.

foreignNames.name: Lähmung
foreignNames.text: Die verzauberte Kreatur kann nicht während der Entap-Phase normal enttappt werden. Der Beherrscher der Kreatur muß in der Versorgungsphase 4 bezahlen, um sie zu enttappen. Tappe die Kreatur, wenn die Lähmung auf sie gesprochen wird.

cards.originalText: Target creature is not untapped as normal during untap phase. Creature's controller may spend o4 during his or her upkeep to untap it. Tap target creature when Paralyze is cast.

cards.name: Pestilence
cards.text:
At the beginning of the end step, if no creatures are on the battlefield, sacrifice Pestilence.
{B}: Pestilence deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.

rulings.text: Each activation is considered a new damage effect. An activation can only be 1 point of damage.
Note that “until end of turn” effects wear off after “at the beginning of the end step” triggered abilities, so an artifact that animates until end of turn can keep this on the battlefield.

It will stay on the battlefield if there is a creature that is put into the graveyard during the end step. This is because this ability will not trigger at all if there is at least one creature on the battlefield as the end step begins.

foreignNames.name: Der Schwarze Tod
foreignNames.text:
Sollten am Ende eines Spielzuges keine Kreaturen mehr im Spiel sein, geht der schwarze Tod auf den Fiedhof.
{B}: Der schwarze Tod verursacht 1 Schadenspunkt bei allen Kreaturen und allen Spielern.

cards.originalText:
ooB Do 1 damage to each creature and to both players.
If there are no creatures in play at the end of any turn, Pestilence must be discarded.

cards.name: Plague Rats
cards.text: Plague Rats's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures named Plague Rats on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: "Should you a Rat to madness tease Why ev'n a Rat may plague you. . ." —Samuel Coleridge, "Recantation"

foreignNames.name: Pestratten
foreignNames.text: Pestratten haben soviel Stärke und Widerstandskraft wie Pestratten im Spiel sind, egal unter wessen Kontrolle. Wenn beispielsweise zwei Pestratten im Spiel sind, haben beide Stärke und Widerstandskraft 2/2.

cards.originalText: The *s below are the number of Plague Rats in play, counting both sides. Thus if there are two Plague Rats in play, each has power and toughness 2/2.

cards.name: Raise Dead
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

rulings.text: You must show the card you bring out of the graveyard to your opponent.
The creature being brought back is chosen on announcement and not on resolution of the spell because it is targeted.

foreignNames.name: Auferstehung der Toten
foreignNames.text: Nimm eine Kreaturenkarte Deiner Wahl aus Deinem Friedhof auf Deine Hand.

cards.originalText: Bring one creature from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Royal Assassin
cards.text: {T}: Destroy target tapped creature.
cards.flavor: Trained in the arts of stealth, the royal assassins choose their victims carefully, relying on timing and precision rather than brute force.

rulings.text: Can’t target itself because you choose the target before you tap him. At that time he is not yet a legal target.
If the creature is no longer tapped when the Assassin’s ability resolves, then the ability doesn’t resolve.

foreignNames.name: Meistermeuchler
foreignNames.text: {T}: Zerstöre eine getappte Kreatur.

cards.originalText: ocT: Destroy any tapped creature.

cards.name: Sacrifice
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Add an amount of {B} equal to the sacrificed creature's converted mana cost.

rulings.text: Sacrificing an animated land gives no mana since the converted mana cost was zero.
You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

foreignNames.name: Opferung
foreignNames.text: Opfere eine Deiner Kreaturen und erhöhe Deinen Manavorrat um schwarzes Mana in Höhe der Beschwörungskosten der geopferten Kreatur.

cards.originalText: Sacrifice one of your creatures to add to your mana pool a number of black mana equal to that creature's casting cost.

cards.name: Scathe Zombies
cards.flavor: "They groaned, they stirred, they all uprose,/ Nor spake, nor moved their eyes;/ It had been strange, even in a dream,/ To have seen those dead men rise."/ —Samuel Coleridge, "The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

cards.name: Scavenging Ghoul
cards.text:
At the beginning of each end step, put a corpse counter on Scavenging Ghoul for each creature that died this turn.
Remove a corpse counter from Scavenging Ghoul: Regenerate Scavenging Ghoul.

rulings.text: The Ghoul still gets to claim counters even if it enters the battlefield after the creatures died.

foreignNames.name: Leichenfledderer
foreignNames.text:
Lege am Ende jedes Zuges für jede Kreatur, die in diesem Zug vernichtet wurde, eine Leichen-Spielmarke auf den Ghoul.
0: Entferne eine Leichenmarke, um den Ghoul zu regenerieren.

cards.originalText: At the end of each turn, put one counter on Ghoul for each other creature that was placed in the graveyard during the turn. If Ghoul takes lethal damage, you may use a counter to regenerate it; counters remain until used.

cards.name: Sengir Vampire
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Sengir Vampire this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Vampire.

rulings.text: If Sengir Vampire deals nonlethal damage to a creature and then a different effect or damage source causes that creature to be put into a graveyard later in the turn, Sengir Vampire’s ability will trigger and it will get a +1/+1 counter.

Each time a creature is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, check whether Sengir Vampire had dealt any damage to it at any time during that turn. If so, Sengir Vampire’s ability will trigger. It doesn’t matter who controlled the creature or whose graveyard it was put into.
If Sengir Vampire and a creature it dealt damage to are both put into a graveyard at the same time, Sengir Vampire’s ability will trigger, but it will do nothing when it resolves.

foreignNames.name: Sengir-Vampir
foreignNames.text:
Kann fliegen.
Lege jedes Mal eine +1/+1-Spielmarke auf den Vampir, wenn ein Wesen, dem er in diesem Zug Schaden zugefügt hat, auf dem Friedhof landet.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Vampire gets a +1/+1 counter each time a creature dies during a turn in which Vampire damaged it.

cards.name: Simulacrum
cards.text: You gain life equal to the damage dealt to you this turn. Simulacrum deals damage to target creature you control equal to the damage dealt to you this turn.

rulings.text: You can’t use Simulacrum on Loss of Life, just damage.
This is not damage prevention or redirection. It actually is life gain and newly dealt damage.
Simulacrum is the source of the damage. If an effect needs to know a characteristic of the damage’s source (Protection from Black, for instance), it will see the damage coming from Simulacrum.

foreignNames.name: Simulakrum
foreignNames.text: Alle Schadenspunkte, die Dir bislang in diesem Zug zugefügt worden sind, werden rückwirkend auf eine Deiner Kreaturen gelenkt. Falls Du in diesem Zug weiteren Schaden erleidest, wird dieser allerdings ganz normal behandelt.

cards.originalText: All damage done to you so far this turn is instead retroactively applied to one of your creatures in play. Even if there's more than enough damage to kill the creature, you don't suffer any of it. Further damage this turn is treated normally.

cards.name: Sorceress Queen
cards.text: {T}: Target creature other than Sorceress Queen has base power and toughness 0/2 until end of turn.

foreignNames.name: Hexenkönigin
foreignNames.text: {T}: Ändere den Wert einer anderen Kreatur Deiner Wahl bis zum Ende des Zuges auf 0/2.

cards.originalText: ocT: Make another creature 0/2 until end of turn. Treat this exactly as if the numbers in the lower right of the target card were 0/2. All special characteristics and enchantments on the creature are unaffected.

cards.name: Terror
cards.text: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

foreignNames.name: Terror
foreignNames.text: Bringe eine Kreatur direkt auf den Friedhof. Dieser Zauber hat keine Wirkung auf schwarze und Artefaktkreaturen.

cards.originalText: Buries target creature. Cannot target black creatures or artifact creatures.

cards.name: Unholy Strength
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1.

foreignNames.name: Unheilige Stärke
foreignNames.text: Die verzauberte Kreatur erhält +2/+1.

cards.originalText: Target creature gains +2/+1.

cards.name: Wall of Bone
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{B}: Regenerate Wall of Bone. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
cards.flavor: The Wall of Bone is said to be an aspect of the Great Wall in Hel, where the bones of all sinners wait for Ragnarok, when Hela will call them forth for the final battle.

foreignNames.name: Knochenmauer
foreignNames.text: {B}: Regeneration

cards.originalText: ooB Regenerates.

cards.name: Warp Artifact
cards.text:
Enchant artifact
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted artifact's controller, Warp Artifact deals 1 damage to that player.

foreignNames.name: Verformtes Artefakt
foreignNames.text: Während der Versorgungsphase des Beherrschers des verzauberten Artefaktes fügt ihm das Verformte Artefakt 1 Schadenspunkt zu.

cards.originalText: Warp Artifact does 1 damage to target artifact's controller during his or her upkeep.

cards.name: Weakness
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -2/-1.

foreignNames.name: Schwäche
foreignNames.text: Die verzauberte Kreatur erhält -2/-1.

cards.originalText: Target creature loses -2/-1.

cards.name: Will-o'-the-Wisp
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{B}: Regenerate Will-o'-the-Wisp. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
cards.flavor: "About, about in reel and rout The death-fires danced at night; The water, like a witch's oils, Burnt green, and blue and white." —Samuel Coleridge, "The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

foreignNames.name: Irrlichter
foreignNames.text:
Können fliegen
{B}: Regeneration

cards.originalText: Flying; ooB Regenerates.

cards.name: Zombie Master
cards.text:
Other Zombie creatures have swampwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
Other Zombies have "{B}: Regenerate this permanent."
cards.flavor: They say the Zombie Master controlled these foul creatures even before his own death, but now that he is one of them, nothing can make them betray him.

foreignNames.name: Zombiemeister
foreignNames.text: Alle Zombies erhalten die Fähigkeit Sumpftarnung und "{B}: Regeneration"

cards.originalText: All zombies in play gain swampwalk and "ooB Regenerates" for as long as this card remains in play.

cards.name: Abomination
cards.text: Whenever Abomination blocks or becomes blocked by a green or white creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.

rulings.text: The color of the blocking/blocked creature is checked only at declaration of the block. If the creature is green or white at that time, it will be destroyed at end of combat even if it changes color before combat ends.

cards.name: Animate Dead
cards.text:
Enchant creature card in a graveyard
When Animate Dead enters the battlefield, if it's on the battlefield, it loses "enchant creature card in a graveyard" and gains "enchant creature put onto the battlefield with Animate Dead." Return enchanted creature card to the battlefield under your control and attach Animate Dead to it. When Animate Dead leaves the battlefield, that creature's controller sacrifices it.
Enchanted creature gets -1/-0.

rulings.text: Animate Dead is an Aura, albeit with an unusual enchant ability. You target a creature card in a graveyard when you cast it. It enters the battlefield attached to that card. Then it returns that card to the battlefield, and attaches itself to the card again (since the card is a new object on the battlefield). Animate Dead itself never moves into a graveyard during this process.
If Animate Dead isn’t on the battlefield as its triggered ability resolves, none of its effects happen. The creature card won’t be returned to the battlefield.

Abilities such as shroud and protection function only on the battlefield unless otherwise specified. A creature card with shroud may be targeted by Animate Dead, and Animate Dead will become attached to the creature that enters the battlefield.

If the creature put onto the battlefield has protection from black—or if the creature can’t legally be enchanted by Animate Dead for another reason—Animate Dead won’t be able to attach to it. It will be put into the graveyard as a state-based action, causing its delayed triggered ability to trigger. When the trigger resolves, if the creature’s still on the battlefield, its controller will sacrifice it.

Once the creature is returned to the battlefield, Animate Dead can’t be attached to anything other than it (unless Animate Dead somehow manages to put a different creature onto the battlefield). Attempting to move Animate Dead to another creature won’t work.

cards.name: Ashes to Ashes
cards.text: Exile two target nonartifact creatures. Ashes to Ashes deals 5 damage to you.

rulings.text: If one of the targeted creatures is an illegal target by the time Ashes to Ashes resolves, it still exiles the other one and deals 5 damage to you.
If both of the targeted creatures are illegal targets by the time Ashes to Ashes resolves, it’s countered. It doesn’t deal 5 damage to you.

cards.name: Bad Moon
cards.text: Black creatures get +1/+1.

cards.name: Black Knight
cards.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Protection from white (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything white.)

cards.name: Blight
cards.text:
Enchant land
When enchanted land becomes tapped, destroy it.

cards.name: Bog Imp
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

cards.name: Bog Wraith
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

cards.name: Carrion Ants
cards.text: {1}: Carrion Ants gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Cosmic Horror
cards.text:
First strike
At the beginning of your upkeep, destroy Cosmic Horror unless you pay {3}{B}{B}{B}. If Cosmic Horror is destroyed this way, it deals 7 damage to you.

rulings.text: If you choose not to pay Cosmic Horror’s upkeep cost, it deals 7 damage to you only if it’s actually destroyed. If it regenerates or an effect has given it indestructible, it deals no damage.

cards.name: Cursed Land
cards.text:
Enchant land
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted land's controller, Cursed Land deals 1 damage to that player.

cards.name: Cyclopean Mummy
cards.text: When Cyclopean Mummy dies, exile it.

rulings.text: The Mummy does go to the graveyard and trigger abilities which watch for something going to the graveyard. It then gets exiled as a triggered ability.
It does not get exiled if it goes to the graveyard from someplace other than the battlefield. This includes discarding from your hand or if the spell is countered.

cards.name: Dark Ritual
cards.text: Add {B}{B}{B}.

foreignNames.name: Ritual Sombrio
foreignNames.text: Adiciona [B][B][B] â sua reserva de mana.

cards.name: Deathgrip
cards.text: {B}{B}: Counter target green spell.

cards.name: Deathlace
cards.text: Target spell or permanent becomes black. (Mana symbols on that permanent remain unchanged.)

cards.name: Drain Life
cards.text:
Spend only black mana on X.
Drain Life deals X damage to any target. You gain life equal to the damage dealt, but not more life than the player's life total before the damage was dealt, the planeswalker's loyalty before the damage was dealt, or the creature's toughness.

rulings.text: Cost reducers can be used to reduce the X part of the mana cost.
You may gain up to the total toughness of the creature even if it was already damaged.

cards.name: Drudge Skeletons
cards.text: {B}: Regenerate Drudge Skeletons. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

cards.name: El-Hajjâj
cards.text: Whenever El-Hajjâj deals damage, you gain that much life.

cards.name: Erg Raiders
cards.text: At the beginning of your end step, if Erg Raiders didn't attack this turn, Erg Raiders deals 2 damage to you unless it came under your control this turn.

rulings.text: A creature “comes under your control” if it enters the battlefield under your control or if you gain control of it while it’s already on the battlefield.

cards.name: Evil Presence
cards.text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land is a Swamp.

rulings.text: The enchanted land loses its existing land types and any abilities printed on it. It now has the land type Swamp and has the ability “{T}: Add {B}.” Evil Presence doesn’t change the enchanted land’s name or whether it’s legendary, basic, or snow.

cards.name: Fear
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

cards.name: Frozen Shade
cards.text: {B}: Frozen Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Gloom
cards.text:
White spells cost {3} more to cast.
Activated abilities of white enchantments cost {3} more to activate.

rulings.text: The extra mana is not considered part of the activation cost. It is a separate cost.
The additional mana is paid at the same time the spell/ability is cast/activated.
The extra mana is part of the total cost, so cost reducers can be applied to this cost.
Activated abilities contain a colon. They’re generally written “[Cost]: [Effect].” Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text.

cards.name: Greed
cards.text: {B}, Pay 2 life: Draw a card.

cards.name: Howl from Beyond
cards.text: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.
